result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Ignition Interlock Device Tampering/Failure to Install/Violate Court Order
Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal 4th+)

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Daniel L Bruggemann

records.addlTxt:
03:50 PM Defendant Daniel L Bruggemann not in court.  Melissa J. Zilavy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
State requests capias remain; bail revoked and forfeited.
Based on defendant's non-appearance Court orders capias to remain.  Court orders bail revoked.

Defendant failed to sign signature bond as ordered by the Court. Upon signing of the $1500.00 signature bond, warrant may be quashed and defendant released.
EXT Code 3
Pre-trial conference on June 17, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  Defendant is not to operate a motor vehicle unless properly licensed.  Comply with all licensing restrictions.   Defendant is ordered to report to the Criminal Traffic Division by end of business on May 06, 2022 to sign their bond.  Failure to do so shall result in the Court issuing a bench warrant.

09:42 AM Defendant Daniel L Bruggemann appeared by Zoom.  Andrew Nesheim appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   All parties have agreed that some may have the hearing conducted remotely. This hearing has met the statutory standards for video conferencing.

Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  
Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  
Court advises of right to an attorney.  
NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED BY COURT.
Defendant is ordered to report to the Criminal Traffic Division by end of business on May 06, 2022 to sign their bond.  Failure to do so shall result in the Court issuing a bench warrant.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 17, 2022 at 03:00 pm.  Check Case scheduled for May 9, 2022.

Request to appear by zoom
  **Reviewed by Commissioner Christopher Bailey on 05-02-2022. Granted.
